result.execSummary:
The defendant James M. Hall was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Stayed until on or before March 5, 2016 between 6-7 a.m.  With work release/huber.  Jail may be served in any Wisconsin county jail that will accept.  Counsel stipulate to 1 day credit.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James M. Hall

defendant.name: Hall, James M.
defendant.address: S3629 Twin Ash Avenue, Lafarge, WI

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant James M. Hall in court with attorney Robert M. Osborne. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Counsel advise the Court that the parties have reached an agreement for resolution whereby the def will plead for an agreed-upon dispo of 30 days jail plus costs.  Def pleads guilty.  Finding of guilty.  Sentence:  30 days jail, with work release/huber, may be served in any WI county jail that accepts, 1 day credit by stipulation.  Costs.  Jail stayed for 30 days - def to report on or before March 5th.
Letter from a Concerned Citizen in regards to JH upcoming hearing (cc by COC office to DA and Defense counsel); Judge Sharp's response
2:55 p.m. phone call from Atty.'s office - not available 2/5 at 2; requests different date/time

clerk phone scheduling with Atty. Osbourne's office - counsel has indicated that def wants to cancel the trial and schedule plea/sentencing; clerk sets for 2/5 at 2 when parties were already scheduled to have the final pretrial; that date/time will be used for plea/sentencing instead; 1/13 status and 2/10 jury trial removed from the calendar

Status conference at 01-13-2016 11:00 am.
Final pre-trial at 02-05-2016 02:00 pm.
Jury trial at 02-10-2016 08:30 am.

Faith from Attorney Robert M. Osborne's office appeared by phone means for Defendant James M. Hall. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant James M. Hall not in court.  Defense is requesting jury trial scheduling.  DA estimates 1 day jury trial; notes she plans to add a repeater allegation to the charge.  Court sets jury trial for Feb. 10 at 8:30.  Final pretrial Feb. 5 at 2; in person.  Final status (drop dead date for whether/not matter is going to trial and for resolutions with plea offers) Jan. 13 at 11.  Jury trial scheduled for February 10, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Status conference scheduled for January 13, 2016 at 11:00 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 5, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Attorney Robert M. Osborne appeared by phone means for Defendant James M. Hall who appears in person. DA Harper for the State. Defense waives formal reading of complaint, requests NG pleas be entered. Parties are working toward resolution. Status requested and set.  Status conference scheduled for October 14, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Counsel's request to reschedule the July 15th adjourned initial

Defendant James M. Hall in court without counsel. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Formal reading waived.  Court states charge and informs def of the possible max. penalties as well as his rights including right to counsel.  Def states he is in the process of retaining Atty. R Osborne; requests adjournment.  Matter adj. to July 15 at 2:30.  If there's an authorization, Atty. O may appear on def's behalf without def's presence.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
15A 009816 - payable split to represent the amounts paid by def and by person on his behalf at the time bond was posted
